brief_summary.textblock:
The amino acid l-theanine (the active ingredient in green tea) is considered to have a
      calming effect without causing sleepiness. This study evaluates whether l-theanine affects
      blood pressure, heart rate, alertness, and sense of well-being.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of the Amino Acid L-Theanine on Alertness and Vigilance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adult

          -  able to swallow capsule

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of the Amino Acid L-Theanine on Alertness and Vigilance

oversight_info.authority: United States: University of Texas Health Sciences Center IRB

primary_outcome.description: The average response time to identify a small rectangle shown on a computer screen.
Degree of subjective alertness, measured on a visual analog scale
Sense of subjective well-being as measured on a visual analog scale

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment
